title: [Neuroscience] Nearly one in five people on Medicare travel 50 or more miles one way to see a neurologist. The study found that people who require specialized neurologic care for diseases such as brain cancer, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and multiple sclerosis (MS) travel long distances most often.
[Health] Prenatal exposure to common plasticizers: a longitudinal study on phthalates, brain volumetric measures, and IQ in youth
